meanings.definition: Not owned or controlled by a particular individual or company.
meanings.sent1: The library offers a variety of nonproprietary books for everyone to borrow.
meanings.sent2: Open-source software is a great example of nonproprietary products available to all.
meanings.sent3: It's like having a nonproprietary pizza party where everyone brings their own toppings!
meanings.sent4: Her nonproprietary approach to sharing ideas was like a breath of fresh air in the competitive industry.
meanings.sent5: The nonproprietary nature of the park allowed visitors to freely explore its beauty.

meanings.definition: Not protected by trademark or patent.
meanings.sent1: The company decided to use nonproprietary materials to avoid legal issues.
meanings.sent2: Many generic medications are nonproprietary versions of brand-name drugs.
meanings.sent3: He joked that his nonproprietary hat was so unique, it could never be patented!
meanings.sent4: The artist's nonproprietary style of painting was a rebellion against traditional copyright norms.
meanings.sent5: The nonproprietary design of the building allowed for easy replication in other locations.
